intro: Piper rusbyi var. hirsutum, commonly known as the hairy soursop, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Piperaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces a fruit that is similar in appearance to the soursop but has a distinct hairy texture on its surface. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often grown for its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties. The variety hirsutum refers to its hairy foliage, distinguishing it from other varieties of Piper rusbyi.
